availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, planter. Mississippi native. Son of Joel Higgins and Ann Louise Gibson Higgins. Married to R. "Bettie" C. Higgins. Father of Sue Higgins, Joel Higgins, Ann Louise Higgins, Mary Higgins, and Aline Higgins. Student in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Planter in Lexington in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District No. 2. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, City of Lexington, 4th Ward, p. 108. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, City of Lexington, 4th Ward, p. 12. Find A Grave, "John Allen Higgins (1831-1880)," Memorial #51275346, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/51275346/john-allen-higgins (accessed August 4, 2017).
